Detailed Description

Reads a XML configuration file to get parameters for an algorithm.

The current implementation bases on the Xerces library. If Xerces is not installed all methods will return false. In general the provided functionality is abstract enough that would allow to replace Xerces, so a factory does not directly depend on Xerces.

bool brics_3d::ConfigurationFileHandler::getAttribute ( std::string  algorithm,
std::string  attribute,
std::string *  result 
)

Get a certain attribute of an algorithm e.g a threshold, etc.

Parameters:
algorithmSpecifies which algorithm will be searched. An algorithm is specified by the tagname of an element in the XML file
attributeSpecifies which attribute of the algorithm (specified by "algorithm") will be searched. An attribute is specified by an attribute of an element in the XML file
[out]resultPointer to a string where to store the result.
Returns:
True if attribute is found, else false (or if an error occurred)

bool brics_3d::ConfigurationFileHandler::getSubAlgorithm ( std::string  algorithm,
std::string  subalgorithm,
std::string *  result 
)

Get the a sub brics_3d/core/component.

TODO: return XML node ID to allow for arbitrary nested algorithms

Parameters:
algorithmSpecifies which algorithm will be searched. An algorithm is specified by the tagname of an element in the XML file
subalgorithmSpecifies which subalgorithm will be searched. A subalgorithm is specified by the tagname of a child element in the XML file.
[out]resultPointer to a string where to store the result. The returned result ist the "implementation" attribute in the XML file.
Returns:
True if attribute is found, else false (or if an error occurred)
